meanings.def: without the help of other people or things
examples: It's hard bringing up children alone.
The assassin said he had acted alone.

meanings.def: lonely and unhappy or without any friends
examples: Carol felt all alone in the world.
I've been so alone since you went away.
He felt lost and completely alone.
I felt vulnerable and very much alone.
I've never felt so alone as I do now.

meanings.def: used after a noun or pronoun to show that the person or thing mentioned is the only one
examples: You can't blame anyone else; you alone made the decision.

meanings.def: used after a noun or pronoun to emphasize one particular thing
examples: The shoes alone cost £200.

meanings.def: to do something without help from anyone
examples: Andrew decided to go it alone and start his own business.

meanings.def: to stop annoying somebody or trying to get their attention
examples: She's asked to be left alone but the press photographers follow her everywhere.
Don't touch me! Leave me alone!

meanings.def: to stop touching, changing, or moving something
examples: I've told you before—leave my things alone!

meanings.def: used after a statement to emphasize that because the first thing is not true or possible, the next thing cannot be true or possible either
examples: There isn't enough room for us, let alone any guests.
I didn’t have any clothes, let alone a passport.

meanings.def: to be independent or not connected with other people, organizations or ideas
examples: These islands are too small to stand alone as independent states.
The problems that research is designed to solve do not stand alone, but are part of a wider context.

meanings.def: to be not near other objects or buildings
examples: The arch once stood alone at the entrance to the castle.

meanings.def: used to say that you will have to wait for some time to find out the result of a situation
examples: Only time will tell if the treatment has been successful.
